description: TO PASS S. 1, A BILL PROVIDING FOR EMERGENCY BANKING RELIEF.
TO TABLE THE MOTION TO REFER S. 233, A BILL PROVIDING FOR REDUCTION OF GOVERNMENTAL EXPENDITURES, TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 2820, A BILL PROVIDING FOR REDUCTION OF GOVERNMENT EXPENDITURES; WHICH ORIGINAL AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT JUDGEMENTS THAT HAVE BEEN RENDERED SHALL BE PAID AND THAT CASES PENDING IN THE FEDERAL COURTS SHALL BE TRIED; WHICH AMENDED AMENDMENT WOULD DISMISS THE PENDING CASES AT THE COST OF THE GOVERNMENT.
TO AMEND H.R. 2820, BY REDUCING DISABILITY COMPENSATION AND VETERANS PENSION BY 15%.
TO AMEND H.R. 2820, BY PROVIDING THAT NO VETERANS PENSION OR COMPENSATION BE REDUCED BY MORE THAN 25%.
TO AMEND H.R. 2820, BY PROVIDING THAT THE RATE OF MILEAGE ALLOWANCE OF U.S. SENATORS TO AND FROM EACH SESSION AND OF DELEGATE FROM HAWAII AND ALASKA AND PHILIPPINES BE 5 CENTS A MILE.
TO AMEND H.R. 2820, BY PROVIDING COMPENSATION MAY NOT BE LESS THAN $1,000 PER ANNUM.
TO PASS H.R. 2820.

TO AMEND H.R. 3341, A BILL PROVIDING FOR TAXATION OF NON-INTOXICATING LIQUORS, BY PROVIDING THAT IF IT IS UNLAWFUL TO SELL OR MANUFACTURE ALCHOLIC LIQUORS OR FRUIT JUICES IN ANY STATE OR TERRITORY IT SHALL BE UNLAWFUL TO ADVERTISE BY ANY MEANS IN THAT STATE, SUCH LIQUORS OR FRUIT JUICES DESCRIBED IN SUBSECTION A OF THIS SECTION.
TO AMEND H.R. 3341, BY MAKING IT UNLAWFUL TO SELL LIQUORS DESCRIBED IN THIS BILL TO PERSONS UNDER 16 YEARS OF AGE.
TO PASS H.R. 3341.
TO AGREE TO REPORT OF COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE ON DISAGREEING VOTES OF TWO HOUSES ON THE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 3341.
TO PASS S. 812, A BILL PROVIDING FEDERAL EMERGENCY RELIEF INCLUDING UNEMPLOYMENT, AND OTHER HARDSHIP, RELIEF.

TO AMEND H.R. 3342, A BILL PROVIDING FOR TAXATION OF BEVERAGES IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, BY PROVIDING THAT LEASES FOR THE SALE OF BEVERAGES DESCRIBED IN THIS BILL BE ISSUED TO U.S. PUBLIC BUILDINGS.
TO AGREE TO REPORT OF THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE ON H.R. 3342, A BILL PROVIDING FOR TAXATION OF BEVERAGES IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO AMEND S. 158, A BILL PROVIDING FOR FIVE DAY WORK WEEK, BY PROVIDING THAT THE BILL DOES NOT APPLY TO PERISHABLE PRODUCTS OF LIVESTOCK, POULTRY, MILK.
TO AMEND S. 158, BY DELETING "CANNERY", SO THAT CANNERIES MAY BE EXEMPTED FROM THE 5 DAY WORK WEEK PROVISIONS.

TO AMEND S. 158, BY PROVIDING THAT NO ARTICLE BE SHIPPED IN INTERSTATE COMMERCE WHICH WAS PRODUCED AT A FACTORY, MINE, IN WHICH ANY PERSON WAS PERMITTED TO WORK MORE THAN 36 HOURS PER WEEK OR 8 HOURS PER DAY.
TO AMEND S. 158, BY PROVIDING THAT ACT DOES NOT APPLY TO IMPORTED TEA, COFFEE, TIN, SISAL, RUBBER, FRUITS AND SPICES.

TO AMEND S. 158, BY PROVIDING THAT NO MANUFACTURER BOUND BY CONTRACT BEFORE APRIL 1933 TO FURNISH GOODS FOR A SPECIFIC TIME IN DEFINITE QUANTITIES SHALL BE INCLUDED BY THIS ACT, IF IT WILL AFFECT THE CARRYING OUT OF THE CONTRACT.
TO PASS S. 158.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, A BILL PROVIDING FOR FARM RELIEF, BY AUTHORIZING SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE TO ESTIMATE CONSUMPTION OF COMMODITIES AND COST OF PRODUCTION.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3835 WAS ADOPTED, WHICH AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE TO ESTIMATE CONSUMPTION OF COMMODITIES AND COST OF PRODUCTION.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE ON THE PASSAGE OF S. 158.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY MAKING VALUE OF SILVER 16 TIMES THAT OF GOLD IN ALL COINS.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY PROVIDING PRICE SUPPORTS ON SUGAR.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY INCLUDING FLAX IN LIST OF BASIC AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES, SO IT WILL HAVE PRICE SUPPORT.
TO RECONSIDER VOTE WHEREBY WHEELER'S AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3835 WAS TABLE THE MOTION TO REJECTED, WHICH AMENDMENT INCLUDES FLAX IN LIST OF BASIC AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES SO IT WILL HAVE PRICE SUPPORT.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY PROHIBITING ENTRY OF FOREIGN MADE GOODS IF THEY ARE SIMILAR TO AND CHEAPER THAN HOME PRODUCED GOODS.
TO TABLE FRAZIER'S MOTION TO RECONSIDER VOTE AGREEING TO GLASS' AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3835.
TO RECONSIDER VOTE AGREEING TO GLASS' AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3835.
TO TABLE GLASS' AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3835, WHICH AMENDMENT DEFINES PROCESSING OF PEANUTS.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY PROVIDING THAT AMOUNT PAID FOR ADMIN- -ISTRATIVE EXPENSES NOT EXCEED 5% OF PROCEEDS OF TAXES.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY PROVIDING THAT NO LAND BE LEASED DURING 1933 FOR THE PURPOSE OF REDUCTION OF ACREAGE IN ANY COMMODITY EXCEPT WINTER WHEAT SOWN FOR 1934.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY PROVIDING FOR LOANS TO FARMERS AT 3 1/2% (APPROPRIATION COSTS GOVERNMENT 4%).
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT OFFERED AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE AMENDMENT PROPOSED BY SEN. WAGNER AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR TITLE II.

TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY FIXING WEIGHT OF GOLD DOLLAR IN GRAINS 1/10 FINE, WEIGHT OF SILVER DOLLAR IN GRAINS 1/10 FINE AT DEFINITE FIXED RATIO TO THE GOLD DOLLAR, AND TO PRO- -VIDE FOR UNLIMITED COINAGE.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3835, BY INSERTING, "BY PROCLAMATION TO FIX THE WEIGHT OF THE SILVER DOLLAR IN GRAINS NINE TENTH FINE AT A DEFINITE FIXED RATIO IN RELATION TO THE GOLD DOLLAR AT SUCH AMOUNTS AS HE FINDS NECESSARY FROM HIS INVESTIGATION TO STABILIZE DOMESTIC PRICES OR TO PROTECT THE FOREIGN COMMERCE AGAINST THE ADVERSE EFFECT OF DEPRECIATED FOREIGN CURRENCIES, AND TO PROVIDE FOR THE UNLIMITED COINAGE OF SUCH GOLD AND SILVER AT THE RATIO SO FIXED."
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY PERMITTING PAYING OF W.W. 1 ADJUSTED COMPENSATION CERTIFICATES BEFORE MATURITY AND DESCRIBING CONDITIONS AND RULES FOR SAME.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY RAISING LIMIT OF SILVER WHICH THE PRESIDENT IS AUTHORIZED TO ACCEPT AS PAYMENT OF FOREIGN DEBTS FROM $100 MILLION TO $200 MILLION.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY ADDING TITLE III, WHICH REGULATES COINING AND THE VALUE THEREOF, GIVING SEC. OF TREASURY VARIOUS POWERS.
TO AMEND H.R. 3835, BY CHANGING ENTIRE AGRICULTURE ALLOTMENT AND SUBSTITUTING RURAL CREDIT LEASING PLAN.
TO PASS H.R. 3835.

TO AMEND S. 1272 A BILL TO IMPROVE NAVIIGABILITY AND FLOOD CONTROL OF THE TENN. RIVER, REFORESTATION AND, "AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPEMENT OF TENN. RIVER VALLEY, BY STRIKING OUT SECTION 13, PROVIDING FOR 5% PAYMENTS FROM PROCEEDS OF 2 DAMS TO STATES OF ALA. AND TENN., AND ADDITIONAL 2 1/2%.
TO AMEND S. 1272, BY PROVIDING THAT BOARD SHALL OPERATE NITRATE PLANTS, REGULATE POWERS AND OPERATIONS.
TO PASS S. 1272.
TO AGREE TO REPORT OF CONFERENCE COMMITTEE ON H.R. 3835.
TO RECEDE FROM THE AMENDMENT #83, TO H.R. 3835, WHICH IS PART IV OF THE BILL.
TO AMEND H.R. 4220, A BILL FOR THE PROTECTION OF GOVERNMENT RECORDS, BY PROVIDING UP TO 10 YEARS AND $10,000 FINE FOR ANYONE EMPLOYED BY U.S. GOVERNMENT WHO GIVES A DIPLOMATIC CODE AWAY.
TO AMEND H.R. 5040 A BILL SETTING GASOLINE TAX AND POSTAGE RATES, BY PUTTING 3% TAX ON PRIVATELY OWNED ELECTRICITY USED FOR HOME CONSUMPTION.
TO AMEND H.R. 5040, BY PUTTING 3% TAX ON ELECTRICAL POWER SOLD BY PRIVATELY OWNED COMPANIES FOR PRIVATE USE.
TO AMEND H.R. 5040, BY PROVIDING THAT NO PROVISIONS OF SEC 615 1/2 OR 616 APPLY TO PUBLICLY OWNED ELECTRIC AND POWER COMPANIES.
TO AMEND H.R. 5040, BY PUTTING TAX ON IMPORTED ARTICLES IF THE DEPRECIATION OF THE CURRENCY OF THE COUNTRY OF ORIGIN IS MORE THAN 5% OF THE STANDARD VALUE OF SUCH CURRENCY.
TO AMEND H.R. 5040, BY CHANGING THE WORD "MODIFICATIONS" TO "REDUCTIONS" PERMITTING THE PRESIDENT TO REDUCE POSTAL RATES IF DEEMED ADVISABLE.
TO TABLE H.R. 5040.
TO AMEND H.R. 5040, BY PLACING RECURRENT QUESTION ON REPEALING SUBSECTIONS (A) AND (C) OF SEC. 1001 OF TITLE 8 OF REVENUE ACT OF 1932.
TO RECONSIDER VOTE ON H.R. 5040, WHICH VOTE DISAGREES TO VANDENBERG'S AMENDMENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 5040, BY STRIKING OUT THE CAPITAL TAX-LEVY FEATURE OF IT, LEAVING IT TO APPLY ONLY AS TO INHERITANCE AND GIFT TAXES AND INCOME TAXES, LIMITING THE INCOMES TO $1,000,000 AND INHERITANCES AND GIFT TO $5,000,000.

TO DECIDE WHETHER THE CERTIFIED COPIES OF CERTAIN RECORDS OFFERED BY THE MANAGERS ON THE PART OF THE HOUSE SHALL BE PRINTED IN THE RECORD, A MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF AN IMPEACHMENT TRIAL OF JUDGE HAROLD LOUDERBACK.

TO DECIDE WHETHER HAROLD LOUDERBACK, JUDGE OF THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF CALIFORNIA, IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY UNDER THE FIRST ARTICLE OF THE IMPEACHMENT CHARGE.  (YES=GUILTY; NO=NOT GUILTY.)
TO DECIDE WHETHER JUDGE H. LOUDERBACK IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY, UNDER ARTICLE II OF THE IMPEACHMENT CHARGE.
TO DECIDE WHETHER JUDGE H. LOUDERBACK IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY UNDER THE THIRD ARTICLE OF THE IMPEACHMENT CHARGE.
TO DECIDE WHETHER JUDGE H. LOUDERBACK IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY UNDER THE FOURTH ARTICLE OF THE IMPEACHMENT CHARGE.
TO DECIDE WHETHER JUDGE H. LOUDERBACK IS GUILTY OR NOT GUILTY UNDER THE FIFTH ARTICLE OF THE IMPEACHMENT CHARGE.

TO AMEND H.R. 5389, A BILL PROVIDING APPROPRIATIONS FOR INDEPENDENT OFFICERS, BY STRIKING OUT SEC. 6, AUTHORIZING PRESIDENT TO CANCEL ANY CONTRACT FOR TRANSPORTATION OF PERSONS OR THINGS, IF HE THINKS IT WILL BE IN THE PUBLIC INTEREST.
TO CONFIRM THE NOMINATION OF JAMES F. MCKINLEY TO BE THE ADJUSTANT GENERAL.
TO CONFIRM THE NOMINATION OF GUY T. HELVERING TO BE COMMISSIONER OF INTERNAL REVENUE.
TO SUSPEND A SENATE RULE.
TO AMEND MR. TRAMMEL'S AMENDMENT TO H.R. 5389, A BILL PRO- VIDING APPROPRIATIONS FOR INDEPENDENT OFFICES, BY REDUDING COMPENSATION TO WOUNDED SOLDIERS BY 25% INSTEAD OF 15%.

TO AMEND H.R. 5389, IN THE NATURE OF SUBSTITUTE, BY PROVID- -ING THAT "NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OF THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT APPROVED MARCH 20, 1933, ENTITLED, "AN ACT TO MAINTAIN THE CREDIT OF THE U.S. GOVERNMENT", IN NO EVENT SHALL WORLD WAR SERVICED CONNECTED DISABILITY COMPENSATION OF ANY VETERAN OR THE PENSION OF WIDOW AND OR DEPENDENTS OF SUCH VETERANS, BE REDUCED MORE THAN 25% OF THE RATE BEING RECEIVED PRIOR TO MARCH 15, 1933." (VICE-PRESIDENT VOTED"YES.")

TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE HAD ON MAY 31 BY WHICH THE SENATE DISAGREED TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 5389, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT PROVISION PERMITTING THE PRESIDENT TO CANCEL OR MODIFY CERTAIN CONTRACTS WHICH ARE DEFINED IN THAT SECTION.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 192, PROVIDING UNIFORM VALUE OF COINS AND CURRENCY, BY MAKING PAYMENT OF OBLIGATIONS NON-RETROACTIVE.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 192, BY PROVIDING THAT THE RESOLUTION DOES NOT EXCEPT OBLIGATIONS INCURRED PRIOR TO DATE THAT THE RESOLUTION TAKES EFFECT.
TO ADOPT H.J.RES. 192.
TO RECOMMIT TO CONFERENCE THE REPORT ON H.R. 5040, A BILL PROVIDING FOR GASOLINE TAX AND POSTAGE RATES.
TO AMEND H.R. 5755, A BILL PROVIDING FOR NATIONAL INDUSTRIAL RECOVERY, BY STRIKING OUT LAST 5 LINES ON PAGE 7 AND ALL OF PAGE 8, THAT CALLED THE "LICENSING SECTION."
TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY PROVIDING NOTHING IN THIS TITLE TO COMPEL CHANGE IN SATISFACTORY EMPLOYER - EMPLOYEE RELATIONSHIPS IN ANY PLANT, EXCEPT TO GIVE EMPLOYEES COLLEC- -TIVE BARGAINING POWER.

TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY PROVIDING THAT ANY TRADE OR INDUSTRIAL GROUP MUST GIVE EQUAL VOTING STRENGTH TO INDUSTRIES, TRADES, GROUPS OF EACH STATE, IN ORDER TO RECEIVE THE BENEFITS OF THE PROVISIONS OF THIS TITLE.
TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY GIVING PRESIDENT POWER TO SET TERMS ON WHICH ARTICLES BEING IMPORTED IN SUBSTANTIAL AND INCREASING PROPORTION TO DOMESTIC PRODUCTION OF SUCH ARTICLES, MAY BE IMPORTED.
TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY STRIKING OUT ALL OF TITLE 1.
TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY STRIKING OUT PROVISO THAT NO MATERIALS OR SUPPLIES SHALL BE USED IN PUBLIC PROJECTS UNLESS THEY WERE MANUFACTURED IN THE U.S.

TO AMEND H.R. 5755, IN LINES 21 TO 23, THE FOLLOWING, "AND ONE-FOURTH IN THE RATIO WHICH THE POPULATION OF EACH STATE BEARS TO THE TOTAL PAPULATION OF THE U.S. ACCORDING TO THE LATEST DECENNIAL CENSUS.

TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY ADDING TO TITLE II - "AND TO REFINANCE ... OUTSTANDING OBLIGATIONS ISSUED IN CONNECTION WITH LOCAL CONTRIBUTIONS MADE TO AID IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF FEDERAL FLOOD-CONTROL WORKS."
TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY AUTHORIZING ISSUE OF U.S. BANK NOTES TO MEET EXPENDITURES AUTHORIZED BY THIS ACT.
TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY INSERTING SECTION CONCERNING USE OF THE ST. LAWRENCE RIVER.
TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY STRIKING OUT SECTION WHICH WOULD AMEND REVENUE ACT OF 1932 BY RAISING 1 CENT TO 1 1/2 CENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY PROVIDING THAT TAXES OF THE SECTION SHALL NOT APPLY TO DIVIDENDS OF ANY CORP. ENUMERATED IN SEC. 103 OF THE REVENUE ACT OF 1932 NOR TO ANY INSURANCE CO. SUBJECT TO TAX IMPOSED BY SEC. 201 AND 204.
TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY INSERTING SECTION PROVIDING FOR GENERAL MANUFACTURES' EXCISE TAX.
TO AMEND H.R. 5755 BY PROVIDING THAT ALL RETURNS SHALL CONS- -TITUTE PUBLIC RECORDS AND SHALL BE OPEN TO INSPECTION.
TO AMEND H.R. 5755, BY AMENDING SEC. 22, CONCERNING TAX FREE INTEREST, MAKING OWNERS OF SUCH SECURITIES FILE RECORD OF THEM, AND INCLUDE AMOUNT OF INCOME RECEIVED.
TO PASS H.R. 5755.
TO RECOMMIT THE NOMINATION OF WALTER H. NEWTON OF MINNESOTA TO BE A MEMBER OF FEDERAL HOME LOAN BANK BOARD.
TO CONFIRM THE NOMINATION OF WALTER H. NEWTON OF MINNESOTA TO BE A MEMBER OF FEDERAL HOME LOAN BANK BOARD.
TO AGREE TO S. RES. 85, PROVIDING FOR INTEREST RATES OF GOVERNMENT BONDS AND FAVORING THE REFUNDING OF GOVERNMENT BONDS AT A LOWER RATE OF INTEREST.
TO AGREE TO REPORT OF COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE ON DISAGREEING VOTES BETWEEN THE TWO HOUSES ON THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 5755.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 5389 TO THE COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE.
TO AMEND H.R. 5389, BY AMENDING SEC 20, AUTHORIZING PRESIDENT TO ESTABLISH REVIEW BOARDS DEALING WITH VETERANS PENSIONS.
TO AGREE TO REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON CONFERENCE, ON DISAGREEING VOTES BETWEEN THE TWO HOUSES ON H.R. 5389.

TO AMEND H.R. 6131, A BILL PROVIDING FOR TAXATION OF INTOXICATING LIQUORS, BY PUTTING $3 PER GAL. DUTY ON WINE AND $5 PER GAL. DUTY ON SPIRITS IMPORTED FROM COUNTRIES IN DEFAULT ON THEIR W.W.I. DEBTS.
TO TABLE HARRISON'S MOTION TO RECONSIDER VOTE ON PASSAGE OF H.R. 6131.
TO RECONSIDER VOTE ON PASSAGE OF H.R. 6131.
TO RECONSIDER VOTE AGREEING TO CLARK'S AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6131.
TO AGREE TO CLARKS AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6131.

TO AMEND H.R. 6976, A BILL PROVIDING FOR GOLD RESERVE ACT OF 1934, BY CREATING FIVE MEMBERS FOREIGN EXCHANGE BOARD, TWO MEMBERS TO BE APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT, THESE 2 TO HAVE A $10,000 YEAR SALARY.
TO AMEND H.R. 6976, BY INSERTING "SOLE" SO THAT SEC. OF TREASURY PURCHASES BONDS FOR THE SOLE PURPOSE OF STABILIZING THE EXCHANGE VALUE OF THE DOLLAR.
TO AMEND H.R. 6976, BY ADDING 750 MILLION OUNCES OF SILVER TO TREASURY.
TO PASS H.R. 6976.
TO AMEND H.R. 7527, A BILL PROVIDING FOR CONTINUATION OF CIVIL WORKS PROGRAM, BY CHANGING $950 MILLION TO $2 1/2 BILLION, TOTAL AMOUNT OF APPROPRIATIONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 7527, BY CHANGING $950 MILLION TO $1 1/2 BILLION TOTAL APPROPRIATION.
TO AMEND H.R. 7527, BY APPOINTING ANY STATE DIRECTOR WHOSE DUTIES INCLUDE DISBURSEMENT OF FUNDS UNDER THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY RELIEF ADMENDMENT OR THE FEDERAL CIVIL WORKS ADMINISTRATION.
TO AGREE TO COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 7527.
TO RECEDE FROM AMENDMENT #4, WHICH GIVES PRESIDENT POWERS TO DISBURSE FUNDS OF THE BILL, H.R. 7527.
TO RECONSIDER VOTE AGREEING TO COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 7527.
TO AMEND S. RES. 184, RELATING TO CONTEMPT PROCEEDINGS AGAINST W. MAC CRACKEN AND OTHERS, BY DIRECTING PRESIDENT TO CERTIFY REPORTS AND PROCEEDINGS OF INVESTIGATION.
TO AGREE TO S. RES. 184 PLACING MAC CRACKEN IN CONTEMPT OF THE SENATE.
TO AGREE TO S. RES. 185, TAKING W. P. MAC CRACKEN INTO CUSTODY, AND JAILING HIM FOR TEN DAYS.
TO AGREE TO S. RES. 186, PLACING L.H. BRITTEN IN COMTEMPT OF THE SENATE FOR DESTROYING SOME OF MAC CRACKEN'S PAPERS WHICH HAD BEEN REQUIRED BY SUBPOENA.
TO AGREE TO S. RES. 187, TAKING BRITTEN INTO CUSTODY, IN JAIL FOR 10 DAYS.
TO AGREE TO S. RES. 188, PLACING HARRIS HANSHIRE IN CONTEMPT OF SENATE FOR DESTRUCTION OF SOME OF MAC CRACKEN'S PAPERS.
TO AGREE TO S. RES. 189, A RESOLUTION JUDGING GILBERT GIVEN NOT GUILTY OF CONTEMPT OF THE SENATE FOR DESTROYING PAPERS SUBPEONED BY THE SENATE.

TO AGREE TO COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7295, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE TREASURY AND POST OFFICE DEPARTMENTS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1935, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT THE WORDS "EQUIPMENT SHOPS, WASHINGTON D.C."
TO REFER TO COMMITTEE ON FINANCE, S. RES. 175, PROVIDING THAT THE NATIONAL RECOVERY ADMINISTRATION IS REQUESTED TO TRANSMIT CERTAIN INFORMATION TO THE SENATE, AT THE EARLIEST PRACTICAL DATE.
TO AMEND H.R. 6663, A BILL APPROPRIATING FOR INDEPENDENT OFFICES, BY RESTORING FULL PAY TO GOVERNMENT EMPLOYEES.
TO AMEND H.R. 6663, BY PROVIDING THAT THE BILL DOES AWAY, WITH RESTRICTIVE PROVISIONS AND PERMITS AUTOMATIC PROMOTION OF CIVILIAN AND MILITARY EMPLOYEES, INCLUDING SALARY PROMOTIONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6663, BY ADDING TITLE III, VETERANS' PROVIS- -IONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6663, BY PROVIDING THAT NO REDUCTION OF VETERAN'S COMPENSATION SHALL BE MORE THAN 25% OR 10% IN THE CASE OF SPANISH-AMERICAN WAR VETS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6663, BY ADDING SECTION AUTHORIZING AND REGULATING PAYMENT OF VETERAN'S CERTIFICATES BEFORE MATURITY.
TO AMEND H.R. 6663, BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF THE APPROPRIATION BE USED IN PAYMENT IN EXCESS OF 85% OF ANY SALARY GREATER THAN $6,000 PER YEAR, EXCEPT JUDICIAL OFFICERS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6663, BY PLACING RECURRENT QUESTION ON BYRNES' AMENDMENT OF COL. 102.

TO REFER S. RES. 181, TO THE COMMITTEE ON FOREIGN RELATIONS, PROVIDING THAT THE PRESIDENT IS HEREBY REQUESTED IF NOT INCOMPATIBLE WITH THE PUBLIC INTEREST TO FURNISH THE SENATE WITH CERTAIN INFORMATION.
TO PASS H.R. 6604, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR CONSTRUCTION OF NAVAL VESSELS AND TO ESTABLISH COMPOSITION OF THE NAVY ACCORDING TO THE WASHINGTON AND LONDON TREATIES.

TO AMEND H.R. 7478 A BILL PROVIDING TO TREAT CATTLE AS A BASIC AGRICULTURE COMMODITY, BY APPROPRIATING $150 MILLION FOR ELIMINATING DISEASED CATTLE AND PAYING OWNERS OF SAME, AND FOR PURCHASE OF DAIRY COWS AND TRANSFER OF THEM TO FARMS WHICH DO NOT HAVE DAIRY STOCK, FOR FAMILY AND NON-COMMERCIAL USE.
TO PASS H.R. 7478, A BILL PROVIDING TO TREAT CATTLE AS A BASIC AGRICULTURE COMMODITY.

TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION (WITH THE RESERVATION) PROVIDING THAT THE SENATE ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE GREAT LAKES ST. LAWRENCE DEEP WATERWAY TREATY BETWEEN THE U.S. AND CANADA, SIGNED AT WASHINGTON JULY 18, 1932.
TO TABLE CAREY'S MOTION WHICH WOULD REFER H.R. 7966, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE USE OF EQUIPMENT, MEN AND FIELDS OF THE WAR DEPT. TO CARRY AIR MAIL, TO THE COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS.
TO PASS H.R. 7966, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE USE OF EQUIPMENT, MEN AND FIELDS OF THE WAR DEPT. TO CARRY AIR MAIL.

TO AMEND S. 2999, A BILL PROVIDING FOR HOME OWNERS' LOAN CORP. BONDS, BY PROVIDING THAT ALL AGENTS AND EMPLOYEES OF THE CORP BE EMPLOYED AND PROMOTED ON THE BASIS OF MERIT, WITH NO CONSIDERATION OF PARTISAN POLITICS.
TO RECONSIDER VOTE AGREEING TO NORRIS AMENDMENT TO S. 2999, A BILL PROVIDING FOR HOME OWNERS LOAN CORPORATION BONDS.
TO AMEND H.R. 8573, A BILL PROVIDING FOR INDEPENDENCE OF THE PHILIPPINES, BY SHORTENING THE TIME IN WHICH INDEPENDENCE IS TO BE GRANTED BY FIVE YEARS.
TO AMEND H.R. 8573, BY ACCEPTING VANDENBERG'S AMENDMENT AS A SUBSTITUTE.
TO AMEND H.R. 8573, IN THE NATURE OF SUBSTITUTE, BY SHORTENING TIMES OF CONSTITUTION FRAMING AND AFTER WHICH, INDEPENDENCE IS TO BE GRANTED TO THE PHILIPPINES.
TO PASS H.R. 8573.
TO AMEND H.R. 6663, BY RESTORING 2/3 OF THE SALARY CUTS OF FEDERAL EMPLOYEES' WAGES MADE BY THE ECONOMY ACT. (AGREEING TO HOUSE AMENDMENTS.)
TO AMEND A HOUSE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6663, RELATING TO VETERAN'S COMPENSATION.
TO AMEND H.R. 8402, A BILL PROVIDING FOR REGULATION OF COTTON INDUSTRY, BY PROVIDING THAT ACT DOES NOT APPLY TO FARMS WITH LESS THAN 40 ACRES OF COTTON.
TO ADJOURN.
TO PASS H.R. 6663, OVER THE PRESIDENT'S VETO.
TO PASS H.R. 8402, A BILL PROVIDING FOR REGULATION OF COTTON INDUSTRY.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, A BILL PROVIDING FOR REVENUE ACT OF 1934 BY INCLUDING MONEY RECEIVED UNDER INSURANCE ANNUITY, OR ENDOWMENT WITH EXCEED AGGREGATED PREMUMS PAID, IN GROSS INCOME.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY PROVIDING FOR MODERATE RAISE OF INDIVIDUAL INCOME TAX IN THE HIGHER BRACKETS.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY REDEFINING CAPITAL GAINS AND LOSSES, AND TAXATION OF SAME.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY INSERTING THE FOLLOWING; IF CAPITAL ASSET HAS BEEN HELD FOR MORE THAN 10 YEARS, (TAX) IS 30%.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY INSERTING SECTION DEFINING CONDITIONS FOR 10% TAX INCREASE.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY PROVIDING 3 CENTS PER POUND DUTY ON VEGETABLE OILS FROM THE PHILIPPINES.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY PUTTING 5 CENTS PER POUND DUTY ON VEGETABLE OIL.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY MAKING PROVISIONS FOR TAXES ON VEGETABLE OIL AND REGULATING CONTRACTS FOR SALE OF SAME.
TO RECONSIDER THE AMENDMENT OF HIS DEFEATED YESTERDAY, PROVIDING 10% TAX INCREASES.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY PLACING RECURRENT QUESTION ON COUZEN'S AMENDMENT WHICH PROVIDES 10% INDIVIDUAL INCOME TAX INCREASE.
TO AMEND THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7835, BY STRIKING OUT SEC. 603, WHICH PROVIDES A FEDERAL EMERGENCY TAX OF 1 PER GALLON OF GASOLINE.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY INCREASING RATES ON ESTATE TAX.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY STRIKING OUT SECTION 141 DEALING WITH CONSOLIDATED RETURNS OF CORPORATIONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY STRIKING OUT SECTION DEALING WITH DIVIDENDS RECEVED BY CORPORATIONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 7835, BY MAKING TAX RETURNS PUBLIC RECORDS OPEN TO INSPECTION.
TO RECONSIDER VOTE AGREEING TO BORAH'S AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7835, WHICH AMENDMENT RELATES TO CONSOLIDATES RETURNS OF CORPORATIONS.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7835; WHICH ORIGINAL AMENDMENT INCLUDES INTEREST ON FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT BONDS IN GROSS, TAXABLE INCOME; WHICH AMENDMENT TO THE AMENDMENT EXCLUCES STATE AND LOCAL BOND INTEREST.
TO PASS H.R. 7835.
TO AGREE TO REPORT OF CONFERENCE COMMITTEE ON DISAGREEING VOTES ON AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 8102, A BILL PROVIDING REGULATION OF COTTON INDUSTRY.
TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF S. 2018, A BILL RELATIVE TO MEMBERS OF CONGRESS ACTING AS ATTORNEYS IN MATTERS WHERE THE U.S. HAS AN INTEREST.  (THE VICE-PRESIDENT VOTED "YES").
TO RAISE A POINT OF ORDER STATING THAT LONG'S MOTION TO DISCHARGE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE FROM FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1 IS NOT IN ORDER.
TO AMEND H.R. 8861, A BILL PROVIDING REGULATION OF SUGAR PRODUCTION, BY FORBIDDING HANDLERS AND PROCESSORS OF SUGAR TO EXCEED QUOTAS OF SUGAR FROM HAWAII OR PUERTO RICO.
TO AMEND H.R. 8861, BY PROVIDING THAT QUOTA FOR PUERTO RICO SHALL NOT BE LESS THAN 875,000 TONS PER YEAR.
TO PASS H.R. 8861.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REPORT ON S. 2999, A BILL PROVIDING FOR HOME OWNERS LOAN CORP. BONDS.

TO AMEND S. 3170, A BILL PROVIDING FOR REVISION OF AIR-MAIL LAWS, BY AUTHORIZING PRESIDENT TO APPOINT COMMISSION TO STUDY AIR-MAIL AND AERONAUTICS; AUTHORIZING POSTMASTER GENERAL TO REINSTATE ANY AIR-MAIL CONTRACT; AND APPROPRIAT- -ING NECESSARY FUNDS.

TO AMEND S. 3170, BY PUTTING AIR MAIL RATE AT 5 CENTS PER OUNCE; AUTHORIZING 2 MILLS PER POUND PER MILE COMPENSATION FOR AIR-MAIL CARRIERS, AUTHORIZING POSTMASTER GENERAL TO ISSUE ROUTE CERTIFICATES AND WARRANTS, AND MAKE NEW ROUTES.
TO AMEND S. 3170, BY PROVIDING SUBSTITUTE WHICH PROVIDES FOR CERTIFICATES OF CONVENIENCE AND NECESSITY, TO DETERMINE CARRIERS.
TO AMEND S. 3170, BY OFFERING SHORTER SUBSTITUTE BILL.
TO PASS H.R. 5950, A BILL TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM SYSTEM OF BANKRUPTCY IN THE U.S.
TO AMEND H.R. 5884, A BILL PROVIDING FOR CORPORATE REORGAN- -IZATIONS, BY ADDING SECTION DEALING WITH BANKRUPCY PROCEED- -INGS BY FARMERS.

TO AMEND S. 3420, A BILL PROVIDING FOR REGULATION OF SECURITIES EXCHANGES, BY CHANGING TWO YEARS TO ONE YEAR AS THE TIME IN WHICH NO ACTION TO ENFORCE ANY LIABILITY CREATED UNDER THIS SECTION, IS TO BE TAKEN.
TO AMEND S. 3420, BY PUTTING FINES OF $10,000 TO $100,000 FOR WILLFUL FRAUD AND 500 TO 10,000 FOR NON-WILLFUL FRAUD.
TO AMEND S. 3420, BY STRIKING OUT "ANY FURTHER FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WHICH THE COMMISSION MAY DEEM NECESSARY FOR THE PROTECTION OF INVESTORS.
TO AMEND S. 3420, BY PUTTING RESTRICTIONS ON LOANS BY MEMBERS, BROKERS AND DEALERS.
TO AMEND S. 3420, BY PROVIDING THAT FEDERAL TRADE COMMISSION SHALL BE SEVEN MEMBERS APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT, NO MORE THAN FOUR OF THE SAME POLITICAL PARTY.
TO AMEND S. 3420, BY PROVIDING THAT FEDERAL TRADE COMMITTEE MAY REQUIRE THE ISSUER TO FILE WITH THE EXCHANGE ONLY SUCH INFORMATION AS IS NECESSARY TO PROTECT THE PUBLIC AND THE INVESTOR.
TO AMEND S. 3420.  THE AMENDMENT CONCERNS REGISTRATION OF SECURITIES, AND INFORMATION NECESSARY TO BE FILED BY THE ISSUER.
TO AMEND S. 3420, BY ADDING TITLE II, AMENDMENTS DEFINING SECURITIES, PROSPECTIVES, UNDERWRITTER.
TO PASS S. 3420.

TO AMEND S. 3487, A BILL PROVIDING FOR A FEDERAL RESERVE BANK LOANS FOR INDUSTRY, BY AUTHORIZING RECONSTRUCTION FINANCE CORP. TO MAKE 20 YEAR LOANS FOR PRODUCTION OR TRANSMISSION OF ELECTRICAL POWER BY PUBLIC COMPANIES.
TO AMEND S. 3487, BY PROVIDING THAT THE RATE OF LOANS IS NOT TO EXCEED 3 1/2% YR. AND 100% OF THE ESTIMATED LIQUIDATING VALUE OF THE ASSETS TENDERED AS SECURITY SHALL BE THE MAXIMUM LOAN.

TO TABLE ROBINSON'S MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE DISAGREEING TO JOHNSON'S AMENDMENT TO S. 3487, WHICH AUTHORIZES RECONSTRUCTION FINANCE CORP., TO MAKE 20 YEAR LOANS FOR PRODUCTION OR TRANSMISSION OF ELECTRICAL POWER BY PUBLIC COMPANIES.

TO AMEND S. 3487, BY PLACING RECURRENT QUESTION ON JOHNSON'S AMENDMENT WHICH AUTHORIZES RECONSTRUCTION FINANCE CORP. TO MAKE 20 YEAR LOANS FOR PRODUCTION OR TRANSMISSION OF ELECTRICAL POWER BY PUBLIC COMPANIES.

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE ADOPTING THE AMENDMENT TO S. 3487, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT IT SHALL BE UNLAWFUL FOR ANY FEDERAL, STATE, COUNTY OR MUNICIPAL OFFICIAL, ANY MEMBER OF ANY NATIONAL, STATE, COUNTY, COMMITTEE OF ANY POLITICAL PARTY, OR ANY OTHER, PERSON EXCEPT BONA FIDE AND REGULARLY EMPLOYED OFFICER, AGENT, OR EMPLOYEE OF THE PERSON OR CORPORATION SEEKING A LOAN UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION, TO SEEK TO INFLUENCE IN ANY WAY, ANY AGENT, OFFICER OR EMPLOYEE OF THE RECONSTRUCTION ON FINANCE CORP. IN CONNECTION WITH A LOAN OR ANY APPLICATION THEREOF.
TO AMEND S. 3487, BY PROVIDING THAT RECONSTRUCTION FINANCE CORP. IS AUTHORIZED TO LOAN DIRECTLY TO MUNICIPLITIES, SUBJECT TO CERTAIN CONDITIONS.

TO AMEND S. 3285, A BILL PROVIDING FOR REGULATION OF WIRE AND RADIO COMMUNICATIONS, BY REALLOCATING FREQUENCIES, VOIDING ALL RADIO BROADCASTING LICENCES, AND RESERVING 1/4 OF ALL FACILITIES TO EDUCATIONAL, RELIGIOUS, AGRICULTURAL AND SIMILAR NON-PROFIT ASSOCIATION.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF S. 2800, A BILL PROVIDING FOR FEDERAL FOOD AND DRUG ACT.
TO ADOPT S.J.RES. 29, AMENDING THE CONSTITUTION BY PROVIDING FOR THE POPULAR ELECTION OF PRESIDENT AND VICE-PRESIDENT.
TO PASS S.J.RES. 29, PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION OF THE U.S. RELATING TO POPULAR ELECTION FOR PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT.
TO AMEND H.R. 8687, A BILL PROVIDING FOR RECIPROCAL TARIFF AGREEMENTS, BY MAKING HEARINGS PUBLIC.
TO AMEND H.R. 8687, BY PROVIDING THAT NO RECIPROCAL TRADE AGREEMENT SHALL BE ENTERED INTO UNDER THIS ACT WITH RESPECT TO ANY AGRICULTURAL OR HORTICULTURAL PRODUCT.
TO AMEND H.R. 8687, BY PROVIDING THAT NO AGRICULTURAL OR HORTICULTURAL TARIFFS TO BE LOWERED BELOW AMOUNT NECESSARY TO EQUALIZE PRODUCTION COST.
TO AMEND H.R. 8687, BY PROVIDING THAT NO REDUCTIONS BE MADE ON TARIFFS ON ANY AGRICULTURAL OR HORTICULTURAL PRODUCTS.
TO AMEND H.R. 8687, BY PROVIDING THAT NO REDUCTIONS BE MADE ON TARIFFS ON WOOL AND ANY BASIC AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES.
TO AMEND H.R. 8687, BY EXEMPTING COMMODITIES OF WHICH 70% OR MORE OF THE VALUE OF MATERIALS THEREOF IS COMPRISED OF FARM, RANCH, OR DAIRY PRODUCTS.

TO AMEND H.R. 8687, BY PROVIDING THAT NO FOREIGN TRADE AGREEMENT UNDER THIS ACT SHALL BE EFFECTIVE UNTIL SUBMITTED BY THE PRESIDENT TO BOTH HOUSES AND PASSED BY MAJORITY VOTE, SUCH VOTE TO BE TAKEN WITHIN 20 DAYS AFTER SUBMISSION.
TO AMEND H.R. 8687, BY PROVIDING THAT EVERY FOREIGN TRADE AGREEMENT CONCLUDED PURSUANT TO THIS ACT SHALL BE SUBJECT TO TERMINATION NOT MORE THAN 6 MONTHS AFTER 3 YEARS FROM DATE OF ENACTMENT.
TO AMEND H.R. 8687, BY PROVIDING THAT THE BILL DOES NOT INDLUDE EXCISE TAXES UNDER SUBSECTION C, PARA., 4,5,6,7, OF SEC. 601 OF REVENUE ACT OF 1932.
TO AMEND H.R. 8687, BY PROVIDING THAT NO AGREEMENTS BE MADE WITH COUNTRIES WHOSE WAGES ARE 20% BELOW OURS.
TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8687, WHICH AMENDMENT INSERTS ON PAGE FOUR, LINE TWENTY, THE WORDS "OR ANY PROVISION OF ANY SUCH AGREEMENT."
TO PASS H.R. 8687.

TO AMEND H.R. 9745, A BILL PROVIDING FOR SILVER PURCHASES, BY PROVIDING THAT PROPORTION OF SILVER TO GOLD IN THE U.S. RESERVES SHALL BE INCREASED, ULTIMATE OBJECTIVE TO HAVE 1/4 OF RESERVES, BY VALUE, SILVER.
TO AMEND H.R. 9745, BY MAKING MONETARY STANDARD OF U.S. BIMETALLIC, IN THE RATIO OF 16-1 SILVER PER GOLD.
TO AMEND H.R. 9745, BY PROVIDING FOR PAYMENT OF VETERAN'S ADJUSTED SERVICE CERTIFICATES BEFORE MATURITY.
TO AMEND H.R. 9745, BY PUTTING 50% OF THE EXCESS AS TAX ON INTEREST OF TRANSFERS, WHERE THE INTEREST EXCEEDS THE COST THEREOF AND ALLOWED EXPENSES.
TO PASS H.R. 9745.
TO CONFIRM THE NOMINATION OF REFORD G. TUGWELL TO BE UNDER- SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE.
TO PASS S. 3231, A BILL PROVIDING RETIREMENT SYSTEM FOR RAILROAD EMPLOYEES, TO PROVIDE UNEMPLOYMENT RELIEF.

TO AMEND H.R. 9830, BY APPROPRIATING AND DISTRIBUTING $400,000,000 FOR PUBLIC WORKS.
TO AMEND S. 3794, A BILL IMPROVING HOUSING STANDARDS AND CONDITIONS, BY STRIKING OUT TITLE III CONCERNING CREATION AND POWERS OF NATIONAL MORTAGE ASSOCIATIONS.
TO PASS S. 3794, A BILL IMPROVING HOUSING STANDARDS AND CONDITIONS.

TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REPORT ON H.R. 9830, A BILL PROVIDING FOR DEFICIENCY AND SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS.
